name: AYUSH KUMAR BHARTIYA
college: Dr. A.P.J. Abdul Kalam Technical University

education.school: Dr. A.P.J. Abdul Kalam Technical University

projects.name: Exam Portal
projects.description: Collaborated with a team to design and develop an online exam portal using ReactJS, NodeJS, and MongoDB. Contributed to the development of the user interface and overall user experience. Developed the login page and user feedback functionality, and implemented regular expression validation for the form.

projects.name: Crypto Tracker
projects.description: Developed a comprehensive web application that tracks real-time cryptocurrency data, featuring an interactive user interface designed with Material-UI and real-time data visualization using charts. Implemented state management using Context API to efficiently handle global state, and integrated third-party APIs to fetch and display live cryptocurrency data, ensuring users have the most up-to-date market information. Enhanced the user experience by incorporating search and filter functionalities, allowing users to easily find and analyze specific cryptocurrencies based on various criteria.

experiences.description: Collaborated with a team of 4-5 designers and developers to create and maintain the companys website. Communicated with stakeholders to gather requirements and provide progress updates.

Successfully Integrated backend APIs to ensure seamless data flow and application functionality. Mentored and provided guidance to junior developers, fostering a collaborative and productive team environment.
Played an integral role as a member of Slum Swaraj Foundation, a community-driven organization dedicated to empowering underprivileged communities.

full_output.name: AYUSH KUMAR BHARTIYA
achievements_and_awards: Completed Amazon Machine Learning Summer School, gaining practical insights into cutting-edge techniques

Achieved the position of First Runner-up in the Inter University Ideathon at Dr. B.R. Ambedkar University, Delhi, showcasing strong ideation, problem-solving, and teamwork skills in a competitive academic environment.
Achieved a notable rank of 53 in Round 2 of Codekaze, a prestigious coding competition, showcasing problem-solving skills and proficiency in algorithmic programming.
